definition: to go well together/to be compatible/to cater to/to please
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: Convenience is， however， in all affairs of life， an execrable test of value.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在生活的一切事務中投合是可惡的實用準則。

sentences.english: That means he must cater to Chinese tastes.
sentences.chinese: 這意味他必須投合中國人的喜好。

sentences.english: It's a question of getting the right mix of policies to appeal to the electorate.
sentences.chinese: 問題是要有能投合選民心意的一整套相配得當的政策。

sentences.english: When an artist deserts to the side of the angels it is the most odious of treasons.
sentences.chinese: 藝術家投合傳統派的觀點，便是最可惡的叛逆行爲。
這想法很投合他的心意。

sentences.english: This is a magazine catering to the interests of adults.
sentences.chinese: 這是一本投合成年人口味的雜誌。

sentences.english: It was clear my plan had taken hold upon his fancy.
sentences.chinese: 很明顯，我的計劃投合了他的心意。

sentences.english: He pretended not to hear, but it was music to his ears.
sentences.chinese: 他假裝沒有聽見，其實那是很投合他心意的好消息。

sentences.english: Our politicians should learn to cater for the man in the street.
sentences.chinese: 我們的政治家要學會投合廣大普通羣衆的需要。

sentences.english: What catches the fancy of the multitude is good.
sentences.chinese: 投合大衆心意的東西就是好的。

sentences.english: So you must make yourself agreeable to your master.
sentences.chinese: 所在你得要使你自己投合你的主子。

sentences.english: The film appeals to young people.
sentences.chinese: 這部電影投合年輕人的喜好。

sentences.english: No. Many TV plays all appeal to young people.
sentences.chinese: 不，許多電視劇都極其投合年輕人的喜好。

definition: to get along well (with sb)/congenial/to speculate (on financial markets)
to not conform to/to be unsuited to/to be out of keeping with/should not/ought out
